19. States must report to the Committee within 60 days on steps taken to implement paragraphs 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, and 17.

20. The suspension of nuclear activities and Iranian compliance with IAEA requirements would contribute to a diplomatic solution, guaranteeing Iran's nuclear program is peaceful; the international community is willing to work positively for such a solution.

21. The Security Council welcomes the commitment of China, France, Germany, Russia, the UK, and the US to a negotiated solution and encourages Iran to engage with their June 2006 proposals.

22. The Security Council reiterates its determination to reinforce the authority of the IAEA, supports the IAEA Board of Governors, and commends the Director General and secretariat for their efforts.

23. The IAEA Director General must report within 60 days on Iran's compliance with the resolution and IAEA requirements.

24. The Security Council will review Iran's actions in light of the report and:
(a) suspend measures if Iran suspends enrichment-related activities;
(b) terminate measures if Iran fully complies with its obligations;
(c) adopt further measures under Article 41 if Iran does not comply.

25. The Security Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
